intro: Gamocarpha multicaulis, commonly known as the many-stemmed cudweed, is a flowering plant native to northern regions of North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It has a basal rosette of leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. Gamocarpha multicaulis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
